title: Reliance on Fossil Fuels for Electricity
description: In 2021, Comoros produced 100% of its electricity from oil, gas, and coal sources, indicating a complete reliance on fossil fuels for power generation.

title: Dependence on Oil for Electricity Production
description: Comoros generated 100% of its electricity from oil in 2021, highlighting a significant dependency on oil as the sole energy source.

title: Minimal F-gases Emissions from Industrial Processes
description: In 2023, Comoros had negligible F-gases emissions from industrial processes, with a recorded value of 0.0001 Mt CO2e, showcasing its minimal industrial pollution footprint.

title: Low Efficiency in Revenue Mobilization
description: The CPIA efficiency of revenue mobilization rating for Comoros was 2 in 2023, indicating challenges in effectively collecting and managing public revenues.

title: Unfavorable Net Barter Terms of Trade
description: In 2021, Comoros had a net barter terms of trade index of 59.8, suggesting less favorable trade conditions compared to the base year of 2015.
